heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: The last storm was on 04 September 2025 which lasted for 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is no heatwave at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwaves, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 8.6°C) and outside temperature (down 7.0°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 10%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 843 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 11.6°C), cloud levels (up 1192 m), outside temperature (up 9.3°C), and dew point temperature (up 6.3°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 843.1m lower than yesterday, 301.6m lower than the past week, 1191.6m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 835m to 3910m and averaged 1342.2m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, dry and less humid conditions and winds will be practically absent. Possible light showers, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and it’s dim outside. No significant shifts in the weather are expected.
